question.name: G1A01
question.questiontext: On which of the following bands is a General Class license holder granted all amateur frequency privileges?

question.name: G1A02
question.questiontext: On which of the following bands is phone operation prohibited?
question.d: 12 meters

question.name: G1A03
question.questiontext: On which of the following bands is image transmission prohibited?
question.d: 12 meters

question.name: G1A04
question.questiontext: Which of the following amateur bands is restricted to communication on only specific channels, rather than frequency ranges?
question.d: 60 meters

question.name: G1A05
question.questiontext: Which of the following frequencies is in the General Class portion of the 40-meter band?

question.name: G1A06
question.questiontext: Which of the following frequencies is within the General Class portion of the 75-meter phone band?
question.d: 4005 kHz

question.name: G1A07
question.questiontext: Which of the following frequencies is within the General Class portion of the 20-meter phone band?

question.name: G1A08
question.questiontext: Which of the following frequencies is within the General Class portion of the 80-meter band?
question.d: 3650 kHz

question.name: G1A09
question.questiontext: Which of the following frequencies is within the General Class portion of the 15-meter band?

question.name: G1A10
question.questiontext: Which of the following frequencies is available to a control operator holding a General Class license?
question.d: All of these choices are correct

question.name: G1A11
question.questiontext: When General Class licensees are not permitted to use the entire voice portion of a particular band, which portion of the voice segment is generally available to them?
question.c: The lower frequency end on frequencies below 7.3 MHz and the upper end on frequencies above 14.150 MHz
question.d: The upper frequency end on frequencies below 7.3 MHz and the lower end on frequencies above 14.150 MHz

question.name: G1A12
question.questiontext: Which of the following applies when the FCC rules designate the Amateur Service as a secondary user on a band?
question.a: Amateur stations must record the call sign of the primary service station before operating on a frequency assigned to that station
question.b: Amateur stations are allowed to use the band only during emergencies
question.c: Amateur stations are allowed to use the band only if they do not cause harmful interference to primary users
question.d: Amateur stations may only operate during specific hours of the day, while primary users are permitted 24 hour use of the band

question.name: G1A13
question.questiontext: What is the appropriate action if, when operating on either the 30-meter or 60-meter bands, a station in the primary service interferes with your contact?
question.a: Notify the FCCs regional Engineer in Charge of the interference
question.b: Increase your transmitter's power to overcome the interference
question.c: Attempt to contact the station and request that it stop the interference
question.d: Move to a clear frequency or stop transmitting

question.name: G1A14
question.questiontext: In what ITU region is operation in the 7.175 to 7.300 MHz band permitted for a control operator holding an FCC issued General Class license?
question.d: All three regions

question.name: G1B01
question.questiontext: What is the maximum height above ground to which an antenna structure may be erected without requiring notification to the FAA and registration with the FCC, provided it is not at or near a public use airport?
question.d: 300 feet

question.name: G1B02
question.questiontext: With which of the following conditions must beacon stations comply?
question.a: A beacon station may not use automatic control
question.b: The frequency must be coordinated with the National Beacon Organization
question.c: The frequency must be posted on the Internet or published in a national periodical
question.d: There must be no more than one beacon signal transmitting in the same band from the same station location

question.name: G1B03
question.questiontext: Which of the following is a purpose of a beacon station as identified in the FCC rules?
question.c: Transmission of bulletins of general interest to Amateur Radio licensees
question.d: Identifying net frequencies

question.name: G1B04
question.questiontext: Which of the following must be true before amateur stations may provide communications to broadcasters for dissemination to the public?
question.a: The communications must directly relate to the immediate safety of human life or protection of property and there must be no other means of communication reasonably available before or at the time of the event
question.b: The communications must be approved by a local emergency preparedness official and conducted on officially designated frequencies
question.c: The FCC must have declared a state of emergency
question.d: All of these choices are correct

question.name: G1B05
question.questiontext: When may music be transmitted by an amateur station?
question.a: At any time, as long as it produces no spurious emissions
question.b: When it is unintentionally transmitted from the background at the transmitter
question.c: When it is transmitted on frequencies above 1215 MHz
question.d: When it is an incidental part of a manned space craft retransmission

question.name: G1B06
question.questiontext: When is an amateur station permitted to transmit secret codes?
question.c: Only when the information is of a routine, personal nature
question.d: Only with Special Temporary Authorization from the FCC

question.name: G1B07
question.questiontext: What are the restrictions on the use of abbreviations or procedural signals in the Amateur Service?
question.b: They may be used if they do not obscure the meaning of a message
question.d: Only "10 codes" are permitted

question.name: G1B08
question.questiontext: When choosing a transmitting frequency, what should you do to comply with good amateur practice?
question.a: Insure that the frequency and mode selected are within your license class privileges
question.b: Follow generally accepted band plans agreed to by the Amateur Radio community
question.d: All of these choices are correct

question.name: G1B09
question.questiontext: When may an amateur station transmit communications in which the licensee or control operator has a pecuniary (monetary) interest?
question.a: When other amateurs are being notified of the sale of apparatus normally used in an amateur station and such activity is not done on a regular basis
question.b: Only when there is no other means of communications readily available
question.c: When other amateurs are being notified of the sale of any item with a monetary value less than $200 and such activity is not done on a regular basis
question.d: Never

question.name: G1B10
question.questiontext: What is the power limit for beacon stations?
question.d: 200 watts PEP output

question.name: G1B11
question.questiontext: How does the FCC require an amateur station to be operated in all respects not specifically covered by the Part 97 rules?
question.a: In conformance with the rules of the IARU
question.b: In conformance with Amateur Radio custom
question.c: In conformance with good engineering and good amateur practice
question.d: All of these choices are correct

question.name: G1B12
question.questiontext: Who or what determines "good engineering and good amateur practice" as applied to the operation of an amateur station in all respects not covered by the Part 97 rules?
question.d: The ITU

question.name: G1C01
question.questiontext: What is the maximum transmitting power an amateur station may use on 10.140 MHz?
question.d: 2000 watts PEP output

question.name: G1C02
question.questiontext: What is the maximum transmitting power an amateur station may use on the 12-meter band?
question.d: An effective radiated power equivalent to 100 watts from a half-wave dipole

question.name: G1C03
question.questiontext: What is the maximum bandwidth permitted by FCC rules for Amateur Radio stations transmitting on USB frequencies in the 60-meter band?
question.d: 3 kHz

question.name: G1C04
question.questiontext: Which of the following limitations apply to transmitter power on every amateur band?
question.a: Only the minimum power necessary to carry out the desired communications should be used
question.b: Power must be limited to 200 watts when transmitting between 14.100 MHz and 14.150 MHz
question.c: Power should be limited as necessary to avoid interference to another radio service on the frequency
question.d: Effective radiated power cannot exceed 1500 watts

question.name: G1C05
question.questiontext: Which of the following is a limitation on transmitter power on the 28 MHz band for a General Class control operator?
question.d: 2000 watts PEP output

question.name: G1C06
question.questiontext: Which of the following is a limitation on transmitter power on the 1.8 MHz band?
question.d: 1500 watts PEP output

question.name: G1C07
question.questiontext: What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmission on the 20-meter band?
question.d: 300 baud

question.name: G1C08
question.questiontext: What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmitted at frequencies below 28 MHz?
question.d: 300 baud

question.name: G1C09
question.questiontext: What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmitted on the 1.25-meter and 70-centimeter bands?
question.d: 300 baud

question.name: G1C10
question.questiontext: What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmissions on the 10-meter band?
question.d: 300 baud

question.name: G1C11
question.questiontext: What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmissions on the 2-meter band?
question.d: 300 baud

question.name: G1D01
question.questiontext: Who may receive credit for the elements represented by an expired amateur radio license?
question.a: Any person who can demonstrate that they once held an FCC issued General, Advanced, or Amateur Extra class license that was not revoked by the FCC
question.b: Anyone who held an FCC issued amateur radio license that has been expired for not less than 5 years and not more than 15 years
question.c: Any person who previously held an amateur license issued by another country, but only if that country has a current reciprocal licensing agreement with the FCC
question.d: Only persons who once held an FCC issued Novice, Technician, or Technician Plus license

question.name: G1D02
question.questiontext: What license examinations may you administer when you are an accredited VE holding a General Class operator license?
question.d: Extra, General and Technician

question.name: G1D03
question.questiontext: On which of the following band segments may you operate if you are a Technician Class operator and have a CSCE for General Class privileges?
question.a: Only the Technician band segments until your upgrade is posted in the FCC database
question.b: Only on the Technician band segments until your license arrives in the mail
question.c: On any General or Technician Class band segment
question.d: On any General or Technician Class band segment except 30-meters and 60-meters

question.name: G1D04
question.questiontext: Which of the following is a requirement for administering a Technician Class license examination?
question.a: At least three General Class or higher VEs must observe the examination
question.b: At least two General Class or higher VEs must be present
question.c: At least two General Class or higher VEs must be present, but only one need be Extra Class
question.d: At least three VEs of Technician Class or higher must observe the examination

question.name: G1D05
question.questiontext: Which of the following must a person have before they can be an administering VE for a Technician Class license examination?
question.a: Notification to the FCC that you want to give an examination
question.b: Receipt of a CSCE for General Class
question.c: Possession of a properly obtained telegraphy license
question.d: An FCC General Class or higher license and VEC accreditation

question.name: G1D06
question.questiontext: When must you add the special identifier "AG" after your call sign if you are a Technician Class licensee and have a CSCE for General Class operator privileges, but the FCC has not yet posted your upgrade on its website ?
question.a: Whenever you operate using General Class frequency privileges
question.b: Whenever you operate on any amateur frequency
question.c: Whenever you operate using Technician frequency privileges
question.d: A special identifier is not required as long as your General Class license application has been filed with the FCC

question.name: G1D07
question.questiontext: Volunteer Examiners are accredited by what organization?
question.d: The Wireless Telecommunications Bureau

question.name: G1D08
question.questiontext: Which of the following criteria must be met for a non-U.S. citizen to be an accredited Volunteer Examiner?
question.a: The person must be a resident of the U.S. for a minimum of 5 years
question.b: The person must hold an FCC granted Amateur Radio license of General Class or above
question.c: The person’s home citizenship must be in ITU region 2
question.d: None of these choices is correct; a non-U.S. citizen cannot be a Volunteer Examiner

question.name: G1D09
question.questiontext: How long is a Certificate of Successful Completion of Examination (CSCE) valid for exam element credit?
question.d: For as long as your current license is valid

question.name: G1D10
question.questiontext: What is the minimum age that one must be to qualify as an accredited Volunteer Examiner?
question.d: There is no age limit

question.name: G1D11
question.questiontext: If a person has an expired FCC issued amateur radio license of General Class or higher, what is required before they can receive a new license?
question.a: They must have a letter from the FCC showing they once held an amateur or commercial license
question.b: There are no requirements other than being able to show a copy of the expired license
question.c: The applicant must be able to produce a copy of a page from a call book published in the USA showing his or her name and address
question.d: The applicant must pass the current element 2 exam

question.name: G1E01
question.questiontext: Which of the following would disqualify a third party from participating in stating a message over an amateur station?
question.a: The third party’s amateur license has been revoked and not reinstated
question.b: The third party is not a U.S. citizen
question.c: The third party is a licensed amateur
question.d: The third party is speaking in a language other than English

question.name: G1E02
question.questiontext: When may a 10-meter repeater retransmit the 2-meter signal from a station having a Technician Class control operator?
question.b: Only if the station on 10-meters is operating under a Special Temporary Authorization allowing such retransmission
question.c: Only during an FCC declared general state of communications emergency
question.d: Only if the 10-meter repeater control operator holds at least a General Class license

question.name: G1E03
question.questiontext: What is required to conduct communications with a digital station operating under automatic control outside the automatic control band segments?
question.a: The station initiating the contact must be under local or remote control
question.b: The interrogating transmission must be made by another automatically controlled station
question.c: No third party traffic maybe be transmitted
question.d: The control operator of the interrogating station must hold an Extra Class license

question.name: G1E04
question.questiontext: Which of the following conditions require a licensed Amateur Radio operator to take specific steps to avoid harmful interference to other users or facilities?
question.a: When operating within one mile of an FCC Monitoring Station
question.b: When using a band where the Amateur Service is secondary
question.c: When a station is transmitting spread spectrum emissions
question.d: All of these choices are correct

question.name: G1E05
question.questiontext: What types of messages for a third party in another country may be transmitted by an amateur station?
question.a: Any message, as long as the amateur operator is not paid
question.b: Only messages for other licensed amateurs
question.c: Only messages relating to Amateur Radio or remarks of a personal character, or messages relating to emergencies or disaster relief
question.d: Any messages, as long as the text of the message is recorded in the station log

question.name: G1E06
question.questiontext: Which of the following applies in the event of interference between a coordinated repeater and an uncoordinated repeater?
question.a: The licensee of the uncoordinated repeater has primary responsibility to resolve the interference
question.b: The licensee of the coordinated repeater has primary responsibility to resolve the interference
question.c: Both repeater licensees share equal responsibility to resolve the interference
question.d: The frequency coordinator bears primary responsibility to resolve the interference

question.name: G1E07
question.questiontext: With which foreign countries is third party traffic prohibited, except for messages directly involving emergencies or disaster relief communications?
question.c: Every foreign country, unless there is a third party agreement in effect with that country
question.d: Any country which is not a member of the International Amateur Radio Union (IARU)

question.name: G1E08
question.questiontext: Which of the following is a requirement for a non-licensed person to communicate with a foreign Amateur Radio station from a station with an FCC-granted license at which an FCC licensed control operator is present?
question.a: Information must be exchanged in English
question.b: The foreign amateur station must be in a country with which the United States has a third party agreement
question.c: The control operator must have at least a General Class license
question.d: All of these choices are correct

question.name: G1E09
question.questiontext: What language must be used when identifying your station if you are using a language other than English in making a contact using phone emission?
question.a: The language being used for the contact
question.b: Any language recognized by the United Nations
question.d: English, Spanish, French, or German

question.name: G1E11
question.questiontext: Which of the following is the FCC term for an unattended digital station that transfers messages to and from the Internet?
question.d: Fail-safe digital station

question.name: G1E12
question.questiontext: Under what circumstances are messages that are sent via digital modes exempt from Part 97 third party rules that apply to other modes of communication?
question.d: When under automatic control

question.name: G1E13
question.questiontext: On what bands may automatically controlled stations transmitting RTTY or data emissions communicate with other automatically controlled digital stations?
question.a: On any band segment where digital operation is permitted
question.b: Anywhere in the non-phone segments of the 10-meter or shorter wavelength bands
question.c: Only in the non-phone Extra Class segments of the bands
question.d: Anywhere in the 1.25-meter or shorter wavelength bands, and in specified segments of the 80-meter through 2-meter bands

question.name: G2A01
question.questiontext: Which sideband is most commonly used for voice communications on frequencies of 14 MHz or higher?
question.d: Double sideband

question.name: G2A02
question.questiontext: Which of the following modes is most commonly used for voice communications on the 160-meter, 75-meter, and 40-meter bands?
question.d: Double sideband

question.name: G2A03
question.questiontext: Which of the following is most commonly used for SSB voice communications in the VHF and UHF bands?
question.d: Double sideband

question.name: G2A04
question.questiontext: Which mode is most commonly used for voice communications on the 17-meter and 12-meter bands?
question.d: Double sideband

question.name: G2A05
question.questiontext: Which mode of voice communication is most commonly used on the HF amateur bands?
question.d: Phase modulation

question.name: G2A06
question.questiontext: Which of the following is an advantage when using single sideband as compared to other analog voice modes on the HF amateur bands?
question.b: Less bandwidth used and greater power efficiency
question.c: Ease of tuning on receive and immunity to impulse noise
question.d: Less subject to interference from atmospheric static crashes

question.name: G2A07
question.questiontext: Which of the following statements is true of the single sideband voice mode?
question.a: Only one sideband and the carrier are transmitted; the other sideband is suppressed
question.b: Only one sideband is transmitted; the other sideband and carrier are suppressed
question.c: SSB is the only voice mode that is authorized on the 20-meter, 15-meter, and 10-meter amateur bands
question.d: SSB is the only voice mode that is authorized on the 160-meter, 75-meter and 40-meter amateur bands

question.name: G2A08
question.questiontext: Which of the following is a recommended way to break into a contact when using phone?
question.a: Say "QRZ" several times followed by your call sign
question.b: Say your call sign during a break between transmissions by the other stations
question.c: Say "Break Break Break" and wait for a response
question.d: Say "CQ" followed by the call sign of either station

question.name: G2A09
question.questiontext: Why do most amateur stations use lower sideband on the 160-meter, 75-meter and 40-meter bands?
question.a: Lower sideband is more efficient than upper sideband at these frequencies
question.b: Lower sideband is the only sideband legal on these frequency bands
question.c: Because it is fully compatible with an AM detector
question.d: Current amateur practice is to use lower sideband on these frequency bands

question.name: G2A10
question.questiontext: Which of the following statements is true of voice VOX operation versus PTT operation?
question.a: The received signal is more natural sounding
question.d: It provides more power output

question.name: G2A11
question.questiontext: What does the expression "CQ DX" usually indicate?
question.a: A general call for any station
question.b: The caller is listening for a station in Germany
question.c: The caller is looking for any station outside their own country
question.d: A distress call

question.name: G2B01
question.questiontext: Which of the following is true concerning access to frequencies in non-emergency situations?
question.b: QSOs in progress always have priority
question.c: Except during FCC declared emergencies, no one has priority access to frequencies
question.d: Contest operations must always yield to non-contest use of frequencies

question.name: G2B02
question.questiontext: What is the first thing you should do if you are communicating with another amateur station and hear a station in distress break in?
question.a: Continue your communication because you were on the frequency first
question.b: Acknowledge the station in distress and determine what assistance may be needed
question.d: Immediately cease all transmissions

question.name: G2B03
question.questiontext: If propagation changes during your contact and you notice increasing interference from other activity on the same frequency, what should you do?
question.a: Tell the interfering stations to change frequency
question.b: Report the interference to your local Amateur Auxiliary Coordinator
question.c: As a common courtesy, move your contact to another frequency
question.d: Increase power to overcome interference

question.name: G2B04
question.questiontext: When selecting a CW transmitting frequency, what minimum separation should be used to minimize interference to stations on adjacent frequencies?
question.d: 3 to 6 kHz

question.name: G2B05
question.questiontext: What is the customary minimum frequency separation between SSB signals under normal conditions?
question.d: Approximately 10 kHz

question.name: G2B06
question.questiontext: What is a practical way to avoid harmful interference on an apparently clear frequency before calling CQ on CW or phone?
question.a: Send "QRL?" on CW, followed by your call sign; or, if using phone, ask if the frequency is in use, followed by your call sign
question.b: Listen for 2 minutes before calling CQ
question.c: Send the letter "V" in Morse code several times and listen for a response or say "test" several times and listen for a response
question.d: Send "QSY" on CW or if using phone, announce "the frequency is in use", then give your call and listen for a response

question.name: G2B07
question.questiontext: Which of the following complies with good amateur practice when choosing a frequency on which to initiate a call?
question.a: Check to see if the channel is assigned to another station
question.b: Identify your station by transmitting your call sign at least 3 times
question.c: Follow the voluntary band plan for the operating mode you intend to use
question.d: All of these choices are correct

question.name: G2B08
question.questiontext: What is the "DX window" in a voluntary band plan?
question.a: A portion of the band that should not be used for contacts between stations within the 48 contiguous United States
question.b: An FCC rule that prohibits contacts between stations within the United States and possessions in that portion of the band
question.c: An FCC rule that allows only digital contacts in that portion of the band
question.d: A portion of the band that has been voluntarily set aside for digital contacts only

question.name: G2B09
question.questiontext: Who may be the control operator of an amateur station transmitting in RACES to assist relief operations during a disaster?
question.a: Only a person holding an FCC issued amateur operator license
question.b: Only a RACES net control operator
question.c: A person holding an FCC issued amateur operator license or an appropriate government official
question.d: Any control operator when normal communication systems are operational

question.name: G2B10
question.questiontext: When may the FCC restrict normal frequency operations of amateur stations participating in RACES?
question.a: When they declare a temporary state of communication emergency
question.b: When they seize your equipment for use in disaster communications
question.c: Only when all amateur stations are instructed to stop transmitting
question.d: When the President’s War Emergency Powers have been invoked

question.name: G2B11
question.questiontext: What frequency should be used to send a distress call?
question.a: Whichever frequency has the best chance of communicating the distress message
question.b: Only frequencies authorized for RACES or ARES stations
question.c: Only frequencies that are within your operating privileges
question.d: Only frequencies used by police, fire or emergency medical services

question.name: G2B12
question.questiontext: When is an amateur station allowed to use any means at its disposal to assist another station in distress?
question.b: At any time when transmitting in an organized net
question.c: At any time during an actual emergency
question.d: Only on authorized HF frequencies

question.name: G2C01
question.questiontext: Which of the following describes full break-in telegraphy (QSK)?
question.a: Breaking stations send the Morse code prosign BK
question.b: Automatic keyers are used to send Morse code instead of hand keys
question.c: An operator must activate a manual send/receive switch before and after every transmission
question.d: Transmitting stations can receive between code characters and elements

question.name: G2C02
question.questiontext: What should you do if a CW station sends "QRS"?
question.d: Repeat everything twice

question.name: G2C03
question.questiontext: What does it mean when a CW operator sends "KN" at the end of a transmission?
question.c: Listening only for a specific station or stations
question.d: Closing station now

question.name: G2C04
question.questiontext: What does the Q signal "QRL?" mean?
question.b: "Are you operating full break-in" or "Can you operate full break-in?"
question.c: "Are you listening only for a specific station?"
question.d: "Are you busy?", or "Is this frequency in use?"

question.name: G2C05
question.questiontext: What is the best speed to use when answering a CQ in Morse code?
question.a: The fastest speed at which you are comfortable copying
question.b: The speed at which the CQ was sent
question.c: A slow speed until contact is established
question.d: At the standard calling speed of 5 wpm

question.name: G2C06
question.questiontext: What does the term "zero beat" mean in CW operation?
question.a: Matching the speed of the transmitting station
question.b: Operating split to avoid interference on frequency
question.d: Matching your transmit frequency to the frequency of a received signal

question.name: G2C07
question.questiontext: When sending CW, what does a "C" mean when added to the RST report?
question.b: Report was read from an S meter rather than estimated
question.d: Key clicks

question.name: G2C08
question.questiontext: What prosign is sent to indicate the end of a formal message when using CW?
question.d: KN

question.name: G2C09
question.questiontext: What does the Q signal "QSL" mean?
question.b: We have already confirmed by card
question.d: We have worked before

question.name: G2C10
question.questiontext: What does the Q signal "QRN" mean?
question.d: Stop sending

question.name: G2C11
question.questiontext: What does the Q signal "QRV" mean?
question.b: There is interference on the frequency
question.c: I am quitting for the day
question.d: I am ready to receive messages

question.name: G2D01
question.questiontext: What is the Amateur Auxiliary to the FCC?
question.a: Amateur volunteers who are formally enlisted to monitor the airwaves for rules violations
question.b: Amateur volunteers who conduct amateur licensing examinations
question.c: Amateur volunteers who conduct frequency coordination for amateur VHF repeaters
question.d: Amateur volunteers who use their station equipment to help civil defense organizations in times of emergency

question.name: G2D02
question.questiontext: Which of the following are objectives of the Amateur Auxiliary?
question.a: To conduct efficient and orderly amateur licensing examinations
question.b: To encourage self-regulation and compliance with the rules by radio amateur operators
question.c: To coordinate repeaters for efficient and orderly spectrum usage
question.d: To provide emergency and public safety communications

question.name: G2D03
question.questiontext: What skills learned during hidden transmitter hunts are of help to the Amateur Auxiliary?
question.a: Identification of out of band operation
question.b: Direction finding used to locate stations violating FCC Rules
question.d: Hunters have an opportunity to transmit on non-amateur frequencies

question.name: G2D04
question.questiontext: Which of the following describes an azimuthal projection map?
question.a: A map that shows accurate land masses
question.b: A map that shows true bearings and distances from a particular location
question.c: A map that shows the angle at which an amateur satellite crosses the equator
question.d: A map that shows the number of degrees longitude that an amateur satellite appears to move westward at the equator with each orbit

question.name: G2D05
question.questiontext: When is it permissible to communicate with amateur stations in countries outside the areas administered by the Federal Communications Commission?
question.a: Only when the foreign country has a formal third party agreement filed with the FCC
question.b: When the contact is with amateurs in any country except those whose administrations have notified the ITU that they object to such communications
question.c: When the contact is with amateurs in any country as long as the communication is conducted in English
question.d: Only when the foreign country is a member of the International Amateur Radio Union

question.name: G2D06
question.questiontext: How is a directional antenna pointed when making a "long-path" contact with another station?
question.d: Toward the north

question.name: G2D07
question.questiontext: Which of the following is required by the FCC rules when operating in the 60-meter band?
question.a: If you are using other than a dipole antenna, you must keep a record of the gain of your antenna
question.b: You must keep a record of the date, time, frequency, power level and stations worked
question.c: You must keep a record of all third party traffic
question.d: You must keep a record of the manufacturer of your equipment and the antenna used

question.name: G2D08
question.questiontext: What is a reason why many amateurs keep a station log?
question.a: The ITU requires a log of all international contacts
question.b: The ITU requires a log of all international third party traffic
question.c: The log provides evidence of operation needed to renew a license without retest
question.d: To help with a reply if the FCC requests information
